newsitem.title: USA: Lazare Kaplan sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Lazare Kaplan sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Lazare Kaplan International Inc said Friday its board had adopted a shareholder rights plan with a 15 percent trigger.
Under the plan, one preferred share purchase right will be distributed as a dividend on each outstanding share of common stock.
The company said the rights are not being distributed in response to any effort to acquire control of the company, and the board is not aware of any such effort.
The rights will be exercisable if a person or group acquires or announces a tender offer to acquire 15 percent or more of the company's common stock.
Each right will entitle the holder to buy one-hundredth share of a new series of junior participating preferred stock at an exercise price of $90.
The distribution will be made on September 9 to stockholders of record on that date. The rights will expire on July 31, 2007.
